alert.note: Alert for Northern Brevard County; Orange; Osceola; Southern Brevard County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 02 at 3:55PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Brevard, southeastern Orange and northeastern Osceola Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 355 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Haulover Canal to 7 miles south of Wedgefield to near Harmony. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Palm Bay, Melbourne, Titusville, Rockledge and Cocoa. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors! A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for east central Florida.
